E812AFDB373B4473881ACB24BF578377.description: Use newly acquired domain-specific words and phrases accurately.

F0D22562B6FB4A2DABBA055F4998359F.description: Use grade appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases accurately within writing.

D2BABDB1DB924B359004FB760BDA266A.description:
Acquire and use accurately general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at
the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase
important to comprehension or expression.

0FBB544D278B42A1A320B11C0B784439.description: Explain differences or changes in the meaning of words with similar denotations.

94DD8B4C9B4840B0A2D3FEDF87CFE34B.description: Interpret figures of speech in context.

D63FAE912E6B4CC19C2D015C83FF25D6.description: Interpret how literary devices advance the plot, affect the tone or pacing of a work.

7C8FBEB32C494029AC32E66BEF8F6C1F.description: Identify the denotation for a known word.

80D79950EC514284BF021B98B1BB081F.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
a. Interpret figures of speech (e.g., hyperbole, paradox) in context and analyze their role in the text.
b. Analyze nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations.

5C6A50E2C89D4529BD49CB38FDC75D7F.description: Verify the prediction of the meaning of a new word or phrase (e.g., by checking a dictionary).

688B2DA977A8437BBFFAC137A79803C4.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the part of speech for a word.

B624BEBB8E2441DA88232E96F990D325.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the precise meaning of a word.

39F74969E5FF46C59C6BAD4D93336DB1.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the synonym for a word.

90B564E0690644F6989476509E015A26.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word's position in a sentence) as a clue to the
meaning of a word or phrase.

7BFCF3319BE0475BB2A655A6EAEDB323.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing
flexibly from a range of strategies.
a. Identify and correctly use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or parts of speech (e.g. conceive, conception,
conceivable).
b. Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning
of a word or phrase.
c. Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the
pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning, its part of speech, its etymology, or its standard usage.
d. Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase.

6984F3EEE52C40D58C59971445732EC2.description: Vary syntax within writing for effect.

2B5800F8954E49BB854B48C31588F1EC.description: Write and edit work to conform to guidelines in a style manual.

3BEA35303A1A48799C7DE10F06500952.description:
Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and
to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.
a. Vary syntax for effect, consulting references for guidance as needed; apply an understanding of syntax to the study of complex texts when
reading.

070EBDA8CA9C453A84BB448524B95A71.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
a. Use hyphenation conventions.
b. Use correct spelling.

7E6DD55696184636923F1EDFDC79D509.description: No CCCs written for this standard.

4F6044AF76674E45AC45136857D43B16.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
a. Apply the understanding that usage is a matter of convention, can change over time, and is sometimes contested.
b. Resolve issues of complex or contested usage, consulting references as needed.

9D5F30C30A824611AD6E2ED616554872.description: No CCCs written for this standard.

C283BF70FA0645DFB1BB48A5CAA202CA.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating a command of formal English when indicated or appropriate. (See grades 11–12
Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

3872E96C962348C8B09F2DE7AAF858F4.description:
Include digital or multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize
salient points.

DB32DE4FC0C541A3BB62E0DC558F1B6B.description:
Make strategic use of digital media in presentations to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence to keep the audience
engaged.

2ADE6E43D21E4445B8A6EBE890E5AE44.description:
Report on a topic, using a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts and relevant, and descriptive details which support
the main ideas.

85EA85EBB4CD46C99E9F8CC41AC625E5.description:
Present information, findings, and supporting evidence in an organized, developed style appropriate to purpose, audience, and task, allowing
listeners to follow the speaker's line of reasoning, message, and any alternative perspectives.

0BD496B9A27A4F2592AFF8A6AE80FF2E.description:
Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, use of evidence, and rhetoric for ideas, relationship between claims,
reasoning, and evidence, and word choice.

1EECEC4A213743D792AE76206DF26361.description: Evaluate the evidence used to make the speaker's argument.

FF84F562A50B42A3A1CF8890A8047D60.description: Determine what arguments the speaker makes.

6C6D961AE306497694378512BBDD0A24.description: Determine the speaker's point of view or purpose in a text.

4CAA6D45083541F08DDBB2B2A4842A6E.description:
Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, use of evidence, and use of rhetoric, assessing the stance, premises, links among ideas, word
choice, points of emphasis, and tone used.

D74927633F404E1180B1F7B695D212FF.description: Analyze credibility of sources and accuracy of information presented in social media regarding a given topic or text.

46E5D330D67D47DDBAEA48C18E276331.description:
Integrate multiple sources of information presented in diverse media and formats in order to make informed decisions and propose solutions,
while evaluating the credibility and accuracy of each source and noting any discrepancies.

289944F7D5A84238812788D0B6B372C9.description:
Use evidence and reasoning presented in discussion on topic or text to make new connections with own view or
understanding.

9F9299233A474480AA870AF084125514.description: Summarize points of agreement and disagreement within a discussion on a given topic or text.

29D4480DC1BF4950B56E3345631A1296.description: Clarify, verify, or challenge ideas and conclusions within a discussion on a given topic or text

F36F4996EDAF4E5BB83E27F0C3478F19.description: Engage appropriately in discussion with others who have a diverse or divergent perspectives.

3499E5BB641A4616A19B64A54110378E.description: Consider a full range of ideas or positions on a given topic or text when presented in a discussion.

D5F02C395C4C445DA09353CD21DD2531.description: Actively seek the ideas or opinions of others in a discussion on a given topic or text.

46D295C0751944BEB0F0634FCD551CFA.description: Work with peers to promote democratic discussions.

F2F7DF04670C417CB6653DF8D2F8FA39.description:
Initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on- one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on
grades 11–12 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.
a. Come to discussions prepared having read and researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence
from texts and other research on the topic or issue to stimulate a thoughtful, well- reasoned exchange of ideas.
b. Work with peers to promote civil, democratic discussions and decision-making, set clear goals and deadlines, and establish individual roles
as needed.
c. Propel conversations by posing and responding to questions that probe reasoning and evidence; ensure a hearing for a full range of positions
on a topic or issue; clarify, verify, or challenge ideas and conclusions; and promote divergent and creative perspectives.
d. Respond thoughtfully to diverse perspectives; synthesize comments, claims, and evidence made on all sides of an issue; resolve
contradictions when possible; and determine what additional information or research is required to deepen the investigation or complete the
task.

DABEFCB72D66481CBBE30EB9AAF420CB.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

DD1A30A2036E449981FC868E483B48DD.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two)
for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

880869DFB48444499C6C301285B8686E.description:
Evaluate an argument within a seminal text or adapted text to determine if reasoning is valid; reasoning is accurate;
evidence is relevant; and evidence is sufficient.

B2E7A5D48FE84AA3884884D2BAB21122.description: Provide evidence from literary or information texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

C25544A57B0C4867850238E7D1C44B97.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
a. Apply grades 11-12 Reading standards to literature.
b. Apply grades 11-12 Reading standards to informational text and nonfiction.

5CB2824169A948AEB4304BAF41A5CDF8.description: Use a standard format to write citations.

462A7D3B0C124A6D934BEC2A3CB4D6B6.description: Use a standard format to write citations.

A8F1FA9AD79747C49EE4854F6EA8FA61.description:
Integrate information presented by others which is determined to be the most appropriate for the task, purpose, and
audience into the writing product while avoiding plagiarism.

AEAF77502B9247578149E97EA8AA8F8A.description:
Integrate information presented by others which is determined to be the most appropriate for the task, purpose, and
audience into the writing product while avoiding plagiarism.

FFAB2E145F814AF0BEF19803F55BD460.description: Gather relevant information about the topic or text and stated claim from authoritative print and/or digital sources.

8CCC4950222141B9B0C1776DE53EAFC8.description:
Gather (e.g., highlight, quote, or paraphrase from source) relevant information about the topic or text from authoritative
print and/or digital sources.

85B12BBCA1BF47E4B7C1229051B4323E.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and
limitations of each source in terms of the task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of
ideas, avoiding plagiarism and overreliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation.

3C272B825DF4471EB8ED3D096B7977B6.description:
Follow steps to complete a short or sustained research project to build knowledge on a topic or text, answer a question
and/or solve a problem (e.g., determine topic, locating information on a topic, organizing information related to the topic, drafting a
permanent product).

0F140AB60BBC4448B58EB0B5E5B8EEF8.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

91D7A424BF0E47F28991A34456E84CD4.description:
Use technology to produce and publish writing. (e.g., use internet to gather information, word processing to generate and
collaborate on writing).

69D1303C18C84DEEB36B78AB882B038F.description:
Use technology, including the internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback,
including new arguments or information.

CC533DCED69C412884339CDC7BDF6FCF.description: Strengthen writing by revising and editing.

8BB6119A192E424F82A389DA8C5BF82C.description: Strengthen writing by revising and editing (e.g., review product, strengthening story).

FCE27EB83F1C44AEA03E506109CF1310.description: Strengthen writing by revising and editing.

6AD84C9040364A94AD9EA293E59308C1.description:
Develop a plan for writing (e.g., choose a topic, introduce argument topic, develop a claim, develop a counter claim,
conclude argument).

F8A472E3D90A46B49CC1EED2896DB386.description: Develop a plan for writing (e.g., choose a topic, introduce story elements, develop storyline, conclude story).

FA24BDC242B946FA88E67728065B2B1D.description:
Develop a plan for writing (e.g., determine the topic, gather information, develop the topic, provide a meaningful
conclusion) focused on a specific purpose and audience.

37730EA5DB3F44098D0FC5872705FDC0.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is
most significant for a specific purpose and audience. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to
and including grades 11–12.)

4EEA4B0D49D34405943E7F412658A2D0.description:
Produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose (e.g., to persuade), or
audience.

6BC8337C308D4CD19903C9B2DA34795F.description:
Produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose (e.g., to entertain), or
audience.

1C504EF8ADF642848604728AEC860EAE.description:
Produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task (e.g., topic), purpose (e.g., to inform), or
audience (e.g., reader).

C1C3C8A01E7348E1B1C14995C8604E7F.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Gradespecific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

7B368B1D49C84BDA92A56B08E1524857.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the
narrative.

9F0247453D4E4897B123733B67EA687E.description:
Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events,
setting, and/or characters.

7AE93894C58E473EA3BA0290FB765A4E.description: Create a smooth progression of experiences or events.

37A8FE5EF8DA45D98423B20AE97C6597.description:
Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole and build
toward a particular tone and outcome (e.g., a sense of mystery, suspense, growth, or resolution).

733177F361804779979D46C45BCF8255.description: Include plot techniques and pacing (e.g., flashback, foreshadowing, suspense) as appropriate in writing.

A5CC32513492449F9709B6963D9D7936.description:
Produce a narrative that includes dialogue that advances the plot of theme (e.g., reveals character motivation, feelings,
thoughts, how character has changed perspectives.

71F97D59AF6C41B6BB0C968FF9EF350F.description: Engage and orient the reader to the narrator and/or characters.

C44C0318309F42B08703152F7A289B4F.description:
Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation, establishing one or multiple point(s) of
view.

0F79A1FDD0174B5D9CAE9A7FD7A6C464.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event
sequences.
a. Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation and its significance, establishing one or multiple point(s) of
view, and introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events.
b. Use narrative techniques to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.
c. Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole and particular tone and
outcome.
d. Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events,
setting, and/or characters.
e. Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative.

6F85C8145D63467DBA3B378808FA2630.description:
Report on a topic using a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts, and relevant, and descriptive details which support
the main ideas.

35AD77FBA0064908A125F6E86E3AF962.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

4171659058FB407E85F63D3695684EC7.description: Maintain a consistent style and voice throughout writing.

B83C79BF2EEF4EBEAB06E9FD65F6376F.description: Use precise language, domain-specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the topic.

43DD7012DCE6481384874553BBCF57E8.description: Use transitional words, phrases, and clauses that connect ideas and create cohesion within writing.

7CD50DE1268F48A6B5F6C20BE417D865.description:
Select the facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples that are most
relevant to the focus and appropriate for the audience.

DFB67FC95E2B46D297A24246130EABBB.description: Write an introduction that clearly previews information to follow.

6A582D1A013C44B7ADE8693C4D7567FE.description:
Create an organizational structure for writing that groups information logically (e.g., cause/effect, compare/contrast,
descriptions and examples), to support paragraph focus.

26147A5BB7154A438F34098FBC1AF3C2.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the
effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.
a. Introduce a topic; organize complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a
unified whole; include formatting, graphics, and multimedia when useful for comprehension.
b. Develop the topic thoroughly by selecting the most significant and relevant facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other
information and examples appropriate to the audience’s knowledge of the topic.
c. Use appropriate and varied transitions and syntax to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among
complex ideas and concepts.
d. Use precise language, domain-specific vocabulary, and rhetorical techniques to manage the complexity of the topic.
e. Establish and maintain a style and tone appropriate to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.
f. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating
implications or the significance of the topic).

F910924C4A9F43838FA6C6C3BD964B5E.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that supports the argument presented by stating the significance of the claim
and/or presenting next steps related to the topic.

448EFCDF7C814A2BB2CAC35BBC1F8698.description: Maintain a consistent style and voice throughout writing.

1643F05C6A64443A9DA8DD2B5802D5F6.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationship among claims, counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

9E333D6315784C49A7AF01E3FBAE5172.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion within writing.

3F745981D16349639746860A2D0B30B3.description: Develop clear claim(s) with the most relevant evidence for a topic or text.

F1DACC2676CF4BCE9DC0445FCBB219AE.description: Select the most relevant evidence for claim(s) and counterclaim(s) for use in writing.

5D09BBA4488E4B8B945FC7569E0B8784.description:
Create a writing organizational structure (e.g., introduce claims, distinguish supporting and opposing claims and relevant
evidence for each, provides conclusion) logically sequencing claim(s), counterclaims, reason, and evidence.

D16668B74BD747B58AB4D2D4326FA3D3.description: Identify claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims(s) in writing.

BB95D11F12FA4CA7B24D75AEB5F3D309.description: Use context or related text to establish the significance of the claim(s).

C9845B1A8E0D47C28001CB66F7142642.description: Introduce claim(s) for an argument that reflects knowledge of the topic.

3CD26A0424004E8790FAD4D51E1BE4CC.description:
Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.
a. Introduce precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establish the significance of the claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing
claims, and create an organization that logically sequences claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.
b. Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant evidence for each while pointing out the strengths
and limitations of both in a manner that anticipates the audience’s knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases.
c. Use words, phrases, and clauses as well as varied syntax to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships
between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.
d. Establish and maintain a style and tone appropriate to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.
e. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

D307782BDE2241A39029210A3F07F3CE.description: Use a variety of strategies to derive meaning from a variety of print/non-print texts.

AFFC6E04227B40AFB4CEB9C674B068C1.description: Independently read challenging grade appropriate texts.

ADC1591CAD3541E481299D1194C28DF7.description:
Read or be read to a variety of texts including historical novels, periodicals, classical dramas or plays, poetry, novels
written by international authors, fiction and nonfiction novels.

068847B3236B4BBF9C76B96A106E974C.description: Use a variety of strategies to derive meaning from a variety of print/non-print texts.

2C1A02F0DD6A43BA9D32B03F436E38AC.description: Independently read challenging grade appropriate texts.

2551E4C94A3546FC8888B919CF4D79B7.description:
Read or be read to a variety of texts including historical novels, periodicals, classical dramas or plays, poetry, novels
written by international authors, fiction and nonfiction novels.

5B946CBA759D44F0A058D4FF54AFCBD6.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend informational text and nonfiction in a text complexity range
determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 11. By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend informational text and nonfiction in a text complexity range
determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 12.

A228699EE4824A85AB916216EA164907.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

6C4BE50F94544CCA9D7627D32C025C04.description:
Analyze seminal U.S. documents of historical and literary significance (e.g., Washington’s Farewell Address, the
Gettysburg Address, Roosevelt’s Four Freedoms speech, King’s ―Letter from Birmingham Jail‖), address similar central ideas.

F3D8F3FC41AA4B948A5E71BF2FDC3333.description:
identify central ideas and concepts in seminal U.S. documents of historical and literary significance (e.g., Washington’s
Farewell Address, the Gettysburg Address, Roosevelt’s Four Freedoms speech, King’s ―Letter from Birmingham Jail).

5795069D15F94F33841117D03BF79586.description: Analyze foundational U.S. and world documents of historical and literary significance for their themes, purposes, and rhetorical features.

90D0B88E8DC7426C947F6DBB4C5C4DFE.description: Assess the validity of the premises, purposes, arguments across texts on related topics.

194FFD365C744E2D8D3A3E78D689C882.description: Delineate the premises, purposes, argument and specific claims in two or more texts on related topics.

2EC201BD97674F299897EB0DE535DB67.description: Evaluate the premises, purposes, argument that the author makes.

E295B7735996492C8EAB56632F6CDEFC.description: Identify claims made by the author as being fact or opinion.

35D7D242FBFE4B2B87B4E7AD1CD71806.description:
Delineate and evaluate the rhetorical effectiveness of the authors' reasoning, premises, purpose, and argument in seminal U.S. and world
texts.

05E28305FE8A4C2C9CA3C704D8FB016B.description:
Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively)
as well as in words in order to address a question or solve a problem.

C96ACCCFC7A84F89AE6D1D5DF521A042.description:
Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in print
in order to address a question or solve a problem.

ABD6678549D6435FA390DF70BF4425B7.description: Develop and explain ideas for why authors made specific word choices within text.

26EF6C21A43644A296F070B1CAAD68A8.description: Determine/identify the specific language/words that the author uses that contribute to the power, persuasiveness, or beauty of the text.

CCF9B7E995074B5DA956C060812CCBCE.description: Determine what arguments the author makes.

C2FD776F69AE4A529445800B2CF61100.description: Determine the author’s point of view or purpose in a text.

4C21DAFC8A2147C69F0621AA46954CA1.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text in which the rhetoric is particularly effective, analyzing how style and content
contribute to the effectiveness of the text.

7A313635F87949F1AFC2807F6010C437.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of the structure an author uses in his or her exposition or argument, to determine whether the
structure makes points clear, convincing.

843BA524E9B54D188D0B1D5E9474E2E1.description: Analyze the structure an author uses in his or her exposition or argument.

7F5D2139C43941FA8D54FC0953AD071E.description: Analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of the author's choice of structural elements and text features.

B6E8A4A515154E0B82A00B472C840BE7.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text including figurative (i.e., metaphors, similes, and
idioms) and connotative meanings.

8FC608D1FF9C4895AF683A1A12111E72.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze how
an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term or terms over the course of a text.

905A973B2B2A4F5B865F7B9CE4DF6F72.description:
Analyze a complex set of ideas or sequence of events and explain how specific individuals, ideas, or events interact and
develop over the course of the text.

69F53F2BF1E24C6A94D2A3C36EF8665A.description: Analyze key points throughout a text to determine the organizational pattern or text structure.

924B023F31CE4C149D4A0B03FD2EF76C.description:
Analyze a complex set of ideas or sequence of events and explain how specific individuals, ideas, or events interact and develop over the
course of the text.

99C92CBF8D5348FBA25FC3734570DC5C.description: Provide/create an objective summary of a text.

547E7535E7C24F2294C966D151A17D66.description: Determine how key details support the development of the central idea of a text.

3E30851514D34107A0968A46972DDC57.description: Determine how the central ideas develop.

9169D83611F047FF93EC65FADB6DD224.description: Determine two or more central ideas of a text.

0884209B7CED4440A189652863EF1B4A.description:
Determine and analyze the development and interaction of two or more central ideas over the course of a text to provide a complex analysis
or objective summary.

374F1288108543809B158C6504248920.description: Determine which piece(s) of evidence provide the strongest support for inferences, conclusions, or summaries in a text.

9EBC627E65C54846A9ED2D5AD96C3DD1.description: Use two or more pieces of evidence to support inferences, conclusions, or summaries or text.

9DB7F41D325043178F1E3EE098C1F200.description:
Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text,
including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

72F0984B5A0A41CDBC53B837E3417C8E.description: Use a variety of strategies to derive meaning from a variety of texts.

6D252166EBE34C79B2BF4E376F76537F.description: Independently read challenging grade appropriate texts or grade appropriate adapted texts.

906AA5C256EC4548A896E553C3E7D56B.description:
Read or be read to a variety of texts or adapted texts including historical novels, periodicals, classical dramas or plays,
poetry, novels written by international authors, fiction and nonfiction novels.

CB263489C31D491987878439D75DEFA2.description: Use a variety of strategies to derive meaning from a variety of texts.

9F0628473A4A4E399BAB0149508A39E4.description: Independently read challenging grade appropriate texts or grade appropriate adapted texts.

F8BEA9D5FEEA4A3DADAA946DC6622CF0.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in a text
complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 11.
10. Read or be read to a variety of texts or adapted texts including historical novels, periodicals, classical dramas or plays, poetry,
novels written by international authors, fiction and nonfiction novels. 1112.HD.a1 By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in a text
complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 12.

A11E222607AD4C22BFFC494E870E1155.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

D4EFEA744CB0460E8797CBEF6C198C0A.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of eighteenth, nineteenth- and early-twentieth-century foundational works of American literature,
including how two or more texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics (historical reflection, social, morals).

08EB5621E31E46C18C84B0288A2F2236.description: Drawing on a wide range of time periods, analyze how two or more texts treat similar themes or topics.

3D4ED3788A1B442C90D80055843D3AE9.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

9F7682648E204503BF485B69E1D900E1.description:
Analyze multiple interpretations of a story drama, or poem (e.g., recorded or live productions of a play or recorded novel or
poetry) evaluating how each version interprets the source text.

668C4EC6A10E4DDCAE06A5B2903D4E71.description:
Analyze multiple interpretations of a story, drama, or poem (e.g., recorded or live production of a play or recorded novel or poetry), evaluating
how each version interprets the source text.

12564E79705747DBB461AF3A01980FC6.description: Differentiate from what is directly stated in a text from what is meant.

FF3B31FE99C34CF78408B826261DB883.description: Using a variety of genres, analyze how the narrative point of view impacts the implicit and explicit meanings in a text.

693972A092524A25A4A0C679EDDF2DC8.description:
Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure specific parts of a text (e.g., the choice of where to begin or
end a story, the choice to provide a comedic or tragic resolution) contribute to its overall structure and meaning.

370E3CFC3ED44CDAB2625FB01DC25A35.description:
Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure specific parts of a text contribute to its overall structure and meaning, as well as
its aesthetic impact.

300AFDABDB2447A480347EFEC76CA48D.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text including figurative (i.e., metaphors, similes, and
idioms) and connotative meanings.

FE7B1D85BF0540F285D484D09C62A58D.description:
Determine the meaning(s) of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings, while analyzing the
impact of specific choices on meaning and tone.

33C0819FFB17405E9B12EDDA62E88A04.description:
Analyze author’s choices about how to relate elements of the story (e.g., where a story is set, how the action is ordered,
how the characters are introduced and developed).

651091D830BE4ACBAB8BD1614AF453E6.description:
Analyze the author’s choices about what is developed and included in the text and what is not developed and included
related to story elements.

AAF5589A71874DFA86A29F04BB401C64.description: Analyze the impact of the author's choices regarding how to develop and connect elements of a story or drama.

10F7BC9F3E004E2B8ECE1D49397BAA16.description: Provide/create an objective summary of a text.

427EBA5A1C1F4E80BADC3736A9B1CF0A.description: Determine two or more themes or central ideas of an adapted grade appropriate text.

A4EF63664C9F40AA9CEEDB8148A98CE4.description:
Determine two or more themes or central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they
interact and build on one another to produce a complex account; provide an objective summary of the text.

E8CB85EEBBE44180AE31A331F490019D.description: Use evidence to support conclusions about ideas not explicitly stated in the text.

4B21B46510A64D6695900727E00FC499.description: Determine which piece(s) of evidence provide the strongest support for inferences, conclusions, or summaries or text.

13CA56014E104C38B8A38D3AB3273342.description:
Use two or more pieces of evidence to support inferences, conclusions, or summaries of the plot, purpose or theme within
a text

1889E53EDED344F69E74824E23301B1D.description:
Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text,
including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.
